DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to compare nurse-led care coordination for persons receiving cancer chemotherapy treatment incorporating mobile health technology to nurse-led care coordination without any mobile health enhancements.
DOC.brief_title: Cancer Care Coordination for Chemotherapy Patients
DOC.detailed_description: This study will randomize sixty (60) participants receiving cancer chemotherapy treatment to receive nurse-led care coordination using a HIPAA-compliant mobile health platform compared to no technology-enhanced care coordination. All participants receive nurse-led care coordination throughout chemotherapy treatment. RESEARCH AIMS: - Demonstration of a HIPAA-compliant social networking platform; - Facilitate communication and collaboration among patients with cancer and their care team; - Assess patient health outcomes (chemotherapy-related physical and psychological side effects; pain, quality of life and patient satisfaction) - Assessment of healthcare utilization including emergency department visits, unplanned clinic visits and hospitalization; - For patients assigned to the mobile health care coordination, understanding their experience of use of the technology
DOC.criteria: 18 years or older Newly diagnosed cancer any site or stage Initiating chemotherapy Ability to read and write English Manual dexterity sufficient to use a tablet technology Cognitive capacity to participate Preferential recruitment of publicly insured and/or living in rural communities Oral chemotherapy
DOC.keyword: care coordination, mobile health, chemotherapy, technology
